results.deck: Based on the Movie and Book. The story of the young farm boy named Eragon who stumbles upon a dragon egg, leading to adventure.
results.name: Eragon

results.deck: 2K Sports 2006 edition of the MLB 2K series. It is also the first baseball game of the "next gen" era.
results.name: Major League Baseball 2K6

results.deck: College Hoops 2K7 was the 5th installation of 2K Sports' popular College Hoops line of College Basketball Games.
results.name: College Hoops 2K7

results.deck: Part of the World Snooker Championship Franchise developed by Blade Interactive.
results.name: World Snooker Championship 2005

results.deck: Group S Challenge is a racing game published by Capcom.
results.name: Group S Challenge

results.deck: A platformer following a weasel and rabbit chained together trying to escape from a product testing corporation.
results.name: Whiplash

results.deck: A action game based on the TV series.
results.name: James Cameron's Dark Angel

results.deck: A first person shooter about a mobster working his way up the ranks in Chicago.
results.name: Chicago Enforcer

results.deck: Narc is a 3rd person shooter in which you play as two DEA agents trying to trace a new drug called Liquid Soul. You play through gritty urban environments and are able to either become a good or a bad cop through a badge rating system.
results.name: NARC

results.deck: Based on the original television show, Battlestar Galactica is a space combat game pitting the ragtag Colonial army against the imperialistic Cylon centurions.
results.name: Battlestar Galactica

results.deck: You play as a former member of the Delta Force turned SWAT. You lead a team of operatives through various missions with multiple mission objectives.
results.name: SWAT:  Global Strike Team

results.deck: A planned sequel to 1995's Full Throttle, this time for Xbox and PS2 as well as PC. It was cancelled by LucasArts.
results.name: Full Throttle: Hell on Wheels

results.deck: Test Drive is a racing game developed by Pitbull Syndicate. In Test Drive, you play as Dennis Black, a street racer who is contacted by a wheelchair-bound man and hired to race in his place in a series of underground street races known as "test drives".
results.name: Test Drive

results.deck: An MMORPG developed for the original Xbox that was cancelled during development.
results.name: True Fantasy Live Online

results.deck: JRPG based around a restaurant sim.
results.name: Bistro Cupid

results.deck: Japanese raising/dating sim, originally planned for Dreamcast. The game's story deals with the royal Ahfolg family.
results.name: Braveknight

results.deck: Xbox-only kart racing game from Atari
results.name: Furious Karting

results.deck: Part two of the Ghost Recon 2 trilogy. Takes place four years after the Gamecube/PS2 Ghost Recon 2.
results.name: Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon 2 - 2011: Final Assault

results.deck: Defender is a remake of the classic arcade game.
results.name: Defender

results.deck: A dark take on The Wizard of Oz, and a spiritual sequel to American McGee's Alice. After its publisher Infogrames/Atari ran into financial problems, the game was cancelled.
results.name: American McGee's Oz

results.deck: 3D comedy action/adventure/RPG hybrid built off of the Spikeout engine. Reimaging of the earlier Mega Drive release.
results.name: Rent A Hero No. 1

results.deck: The official game of the 2005 World Series of Poker.
results.name: World Series of Poker

results.deck: A racing game which follows the 2003 film.
results.name: The Italian Job

results.deck: An open-world crime game, developed by Edge of Reality, that would have starred Snoop Dogg as a thug living in South Central L.A. The game was cancelled on March 1, 2006.
results.name: Fear & Respect

results.deck: A hunting game and sequel to the original Cabela's Dangerous Hunts.
results.name: Cabela's Dangerous Hunts 2

results.deck: A Cabela's game that incorporates hunting AND fishing. Wow!
results.name: Cabela's Outdoor Adventures

results.deck: A game in which you play as a stunt driver for movies.
results.name: Chase: Hollywood Stunt Driver

results.deck: A game based on the monkey that is a wee bit curious.
results.name: Curious George

results.deck: The fourth Xbox-exclusive DDR game.
results.name: Dance Dance Revolution ULTRAMIX 4

results.deck: This Xbox version of Painkiller features a remix of levels from the original game and the expansion pack, Battle out of Hell, as well as exclusive new levels designed for the console game.
results.name: Painkiller: Hell Wars

results.deck: Renegade Paintball is a game which simulates all types of paintball through single player and multiplayer matches.
results.name: Renegade Paintball

results.deck: The official video game of the England International football team, fully endorsed by the Football Association.
results.name: England International Football

results.deck: Mech action game developed by FromSoftware and published by Ubisoft.
results.name: Murakumo: Renegade Mech Pursuit

results.deck: One of two versions of Splinter Cell: Double Agent.  While both generally follow the same story, the two have vital differences in gameplay and overall structure.
results.name: Tom Clancy's Splinter Cell: Double Agent

results.deck: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is a Beat'em Up from Konami, based on the 2003 animated series.
results.name: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles

results.deck: Gravity Games Bike: Street Vert Dirt is a BMX game for the Playstation 2 and Xbox
results.name: Gravity Games Bike: Street Vert Dirt

results.deck: A third-person shooter based on Vertigo's 100 Bullets comic book. It was canceled when the developer, Acclaim, went bankrupt, and later attempts to revive the project never came to fruition.
results.name: 100 Bullets

results.deck: Crash 'n' Burn is a PS2 and Xbox racing game which focuses on doing anything necessary to win the race. The game features a sophisticated damage system, and up to 16 cars playing at once online.
results.name: Crash 'n' Burn

results.deck: Atari Anthology is a collection of over 80 Atari games released in 2003 as Atari - 80 Classic Games in One! for Microsoft Windows, and in 2004 for the Xbox and PlayStation 2
results.name: Atari Anthology

results.deck: Bass Pro Shops Trophy Hunter '07 puts the player in control of the hunt, allowing them to explore a variety of areas and hunt the animals that live there.
results.name: Bass Pro Shops Trophy Hunter 2007

results.deck: Timber is an arcade game manufactured by Midway in 1984.
results.name: Timber

results.deck: A party game featuring Nicktoons characters.
results.name: Nickelodeon Party Blast

results.deck: WWF RAW is the first WWF licensed wrestling game available for the Xbox.
results.name: WWF Raw

results.deck: Konami tries its hand at pro basketball on the PS2 and Xbox.
results.name: NBA Starting Five

results.deck: This Xbox pre-historic action adventure title went through years of development before officially being canceled in 2005.
results.name: B.C.

results.deck: Acclaim's attempt to revive the classic arcade game for PS2 and Xbox.
results.name: NBA Jam

results.deck: Acclaim brings 4-on-4 street soccer to the PS2 and PC.  This version was released only in Europe.
results.name: Urban Freestyle Soccer

results.deck: Capcom brings the world of bass fishing exclusively to the Xbox.
results.name: Pro Cast Sports Fishing

results.deck: Choose from one of 320 Division I schools and enter the 30 year dynasty mode.
results.name: NCAA March Madness 2004

results.deck: Microsoft brings karaoke to the Xbox along with a track editor, visual effects editor, and the ability to transfer songs to and from the PC.
results.name: Xbox Music Mixer

results.deck: This Dead to Rights spin-off was canceled before release.  It followed an honest cop named Santini in the middle of an undercover investigation.
results.name: Extreme Force: Grant City Anti-Crime

results.deck: This survival horror title was cancelled two months after it was unveiled at E3 2004.
results.name: Dead Rush

results.deck: Bethesda brings 50 vehicles, 24 pro drivers, and 11 sanctioned tracks to the 2005 edition of their drag racing franchise.
results.name: IHRA Professional Drag Racing 2005

results.deck: An action game based on the movie, which is based on the popular children's book.
results.name: Zathura

results.deck: Bethesda's drag racing franchise for 2006.
results.name: IHRA Drag Racing: Sportsman Edition

results.deck: Set to coincide with the 30th anniversary of the film, Majesco's Taxi Driver game was unfortunately canceled amidst financial problems in late 2005.
results.name: Taxi Driver

results.deck: This canceled FPS was planned to tell an untold story during Season 8 of the television show.  Development stopped in late 2006.  A legal battle then ensued between JoWood and Perception over the rights to the franchise.
results.name: Stargate SG-1: The Alliance

results.deck: Arcade style Rugby game
results.name: World Championship Rugby

results.deck: The first game in the critically acclaimed "Ultimate Racing Technology" series developed by Climax and published by THQ.
results.name: MotoGP: Ultimate Racing Technology

results.deck: Snake Plissken's Escape is a unreleased game based on John Carpenter's Snake Plissken character.  The game was set to be released in "2005 AD."
results.name: Snake Plissken's Escape

results.deck: In Sneakers, players play as a mouse named Apollo as he looks for his friend's brother.
results.name: Sneakers

results.deck: Powerdrome is a sport born in the gutters of a universe ripped apart by war, devised as the fastest, most viscerally intense racing experience imaginable. Powerdrome is a budget title similar to F-Zero and Wipeout.
results.name: Powerdrome

results.deck: High Rollers Casino is a casino related video game released for the PS2 and Xbox.
results.name: High Rollers Casino

results.deck: Stacked with Daniel Negreanu is a poker based game that was released for the PC, PS2, Xbox and PSP.
results.name: Stacked with Daniel Negreanu

results.deck: Released exclusively through Bass Pro Shops, this game allows you to fish great locations.
results.name: Bass Pro Shops: Trophy Bass 2007

results.deck: Part of Andamiro's Pump It Up series of music games. Released for Arcade, Playstation 2 and Xbox.
results.name: Pump It Up: Exceed

results.deck: Originally released in PAL regions as Urban Freestyle Soccer, it was released in the US exclusively through Blockbuster as Freestyle Street Soccer.
results.name: Freestyle Street Soccer

results.deck: Sega's NCAA basketball game for the 2003 season. It would be 2K4 chronologically. Former Texas Longhorn guard, T.J. Ford was on the cover.
results.name: ESPN College Hoops

results.deck: 3rd person shooter for PS2 and Xbox (PAL only). Based on 80s hit TV-series.
results.name: Miami Vice

results.deck: TD Overdrive is a racing game, part of the Test Drive series. It was released for the Xbox, PlayStation 2 and Windows platforms.
results.name: TD Overdrive: The Brotherhood of Speed

results.deck: A racing game that occurs on miniature level with tracks that can be found within the home.
results.name: Room Zoom: Race for Impact

results.deck: Based on the famous race around France, Tour de France is a cycling game for PS2 and Xbox from Konami.
results.name: Tour de France

results.deck: This page would cover everything about the SnoCross 2 game. It would cover new features and changes from the first game.
results.name: SnoCross 2: Featuring Blair Morgan

results.deck: Sam & Max Plunge Through Space is a canceled adventure game. It was canceled after the developer, Infinite Machine, went bankrupt in 2002.
results.name: Sam & Max Plunge Through Space

results.deck: A rally racing game based on the Race of Champions
results.name: Rally Fusion: Race of Champions

results.deck: A soccer game from Konami first released in 2001 on the Playstation 2. It was later ported to the GameCube and Xbox in 2002.
results.name: ESPN MLS ExtraTime

results.deck: Third game in the MTV Music Generator series.
results.name: MTV Music Generator 3: This is the Remix

results.deck: Control a tiny helicopter in real-world environments in this 2003 release from Aquasystem.
results.name: Petit Copter

results.deck: Real World Golf was released alongside the "Gametrak" peripheral in 2006 by Madcatz. It approximates real golf using straps attached to the player's wrists.
results.name: Real World Golf

results.deck: A racing game released in 2003 featuring Mercedes-Benz automobiles.
results.name: World Racing

results.deck: The Unseen was a video game being developed by Tremor Entertainment for the Xbox until it was canceled in 2002
results.name: The Unseen

results.deck: An Oddworld game announced shortly after the release of Stranger's Wrath that was ultimately cancelled when Oddworld Inhabitants ceased internal production in 2005.
results.name: The Brutal Ballad of Fangus Klot

results.deck: A codemasters indycar racing game.
results.name: IndyCar Series 2005

results.deck: A cancelled game based around George Romero's zombie movies.
results.name: City of the Dead

results.deck: Futuristic racing game. Unique orb system for speeding around turns.
results.name: Pulse Racer

results.deck: Part of the bubble-popping Bust-A-Move franchise. Various multiplayer options including online.
results.name: Ultra Bust-A-Move

results.deck: The 2002 version published and developed by Atari.
results.name: Micro Machines

results.deck: Crank the Weasel is a platform/adventure hybrid game developed by Midway Games.  It was canceled in 2003.
results.name: Crank the Weasel

results.deck: A third-person, adventure/hunting game based loosely on Sir Arthur Conan Doyles The Lost World in which youre out to tranquilize all the dinosaurs before a volcano extincts them again!
results.name: Dinosaur Hunting

results.deck: Third person stealth adventure game.
results.name: World War II: Prisoner of War

results.deck: Downhill skiing game.
results.name: Ski Racing 2005 - Featuring Hermann Maier

results.deck: Xbox exclusive baseball game from Sega.
results.name: World Series Baseball

results.deck: Game for Xbox, PS2 and PC.
results.name: Yetisports Arctic Adventure

results.deck: Downhill skiing game.
results.name: Ski Racing 2006 - Featuring Hermann Maier

results.deck: Billiard game.
results.name: Pool Shark 2
